moves.3. Nc3 Bb4: The amateur plays a sharp variation.
moves.4. e3: Reshevsky is unworried and simply continues developing.
moves.4... c5: Trying to break the center apart.
moves.5. Nge2: Now capturing the White QN will not double White's Pawns.
moves.6... Qa5: Freezing the Bishop in place, but also playing for a trap: PxB?? would now be answerd by ...QxR!
moves.7. Bd2: Adding support and breaking the pin.
moves.8. axb4: Reshevsky pounces, winng the Bishop and attacking the Queen.
moves.8... Nxb4: Indirectly guarding the Queen by means of a trap...
moves.9. Rxa5: ...which Reshevsky falls straight into. Now the lightning bolt strikes.
